sect1.title: Type Operators
sect1.para:
instanceof does not throw any error if the variable being tested is not an object, it simply returns &false;. Constants, however, were not allowed prior to PHP 7.3.0.
Using instanceof to test other variables
<?php $a = 1; $b = NULL; $c = imagecreate(5, 5); var_dump($a instanceof stdClass); // $a is an integer var_dump($b instanceof stdClass); // $b is NULL var_dump($c instanceof stdClass); // $c is a resource var_dump(FALSE instanceof stdClass); ?>
&example.outputs;
bool(false) bool(false) bool(false) PHP Fatal error: instanceof expects an object instance, constant given

As of PHP 7.3.0, constants are allowed on the left-hand-side of the instanceof operator.
Using instanceof to test constants
<?php var_dump(FALSE instanceof stdClass); ?>
&example.outputs.73;
bool(false)
sect1.simpara: The instanceof operator has a functional variant with the is_a function.
